item.description: ^ for my French compatriots, the reference is Nelson before the battle of Trafalgar.https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_expects_that_every_man_will_do_his_duty

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: Our lab has been in this space for nearly 20 years. I helped design the space when the building was being constructed. Yet, I learned just now that there is a light under the kitchen cabinet.

item.title: Bob Jamieson
item.description: The Scottish Greens have said the next UK government must ensure train travel is cheaper than flying in a bid to cut emissions.The Greens are asking the next government to use taxation on aviation, including a flyer levy, in order to subsidise rail tickets on certain routes.https://news.stv.tv/politics/next-uk-government-must-make-trains-cheaper-than-flights-scottish-greens-say#ScottishGreens #TravelCosts #trains #transport #ClimateChange

item.title: Jan Rosenow
item.description: This is such a fun article! How a new generation of engineers push heat pumps to the efficiency limit. https://www.wired.com/story/heat-pump-maximum-efficiency/

item.title: Annemarie Bridy
item.description: I keep thinking about how 3 sitting SCOTUS justices were GOP operatives on the Bush team in FL back in 2000. Supreme Court is about to have 3 Bush v. Gore alumni sitting on the bench | CNN Politics https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/17/politics/bush-v-gore-barrett-kavanaugh-roberts-supreme-court/index.html

item.title: M.S. Bellows, Jr.
item.description: Know what would destroy the Roberts Court faster than anything? A Judges' Revolt. If I were a federal judge, I'd decline to honor any of the controversial Roberts Court decisions. I'd openly say, "that decision is not good law because the Court as currently constituted is corrupt and illegitimate, and to follow its decrees would be to violate my oath to the Constitution."Impeach me. Do it. See if you can get the Senate votes. Otherwise, I'm appointed for life. Now imagine if dozens of federal judges, trial and appellate, did the same thing. Yes, I am a lawyer. Yes, I am serious.

item.title: Bret Carmichael
item.description:
This is a smart move by @Mastodon. #Twitter / #X journalism is struggling, and #Threads doesn’t want journalism. Mastodon is leaning into it though, “To reinforce and encourage Mastodon as the go-to place for journalism, we’re launching a new feature today.” I think this is a lever for differentiation; making Mastodon more valuable to journalists and users.
https://mastodon.social/@Mastodon/112718231305707672

item.title: Rebecca Sear
item.description: One of the co-authors on our STAT article about scientific racism, Dan Samorodnitsky, offers some reflections on the piece, including asking why it’s so hard to get this kind of shockingly poor quality & blatantly ideological “research” out of the scientific literature https://www.sequencermag.com/call-a-spade-a-spade/

item.title: Earl K. Miller

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
More evidence for the role of beta in control.Low and high beta rhythms have different motor cortical sources and distinct roles in movement control and spatiotemporal attention
https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.3002670
#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: I just learned that the first author, Susan M. Courtney, recently passed. How sad.

item.title: Nils Wilcke
item.description: La direction de BFM ne considère pas Tondelier comme "un représentant majeur" du NFP et déprogramme son grand débat avec elle, Attal et Bardella pour un entretien individuel mercredi soir. Preuve éclatante de sexisme de la part de la chaîne qui se couche face au RN. Quelle honte...#Politique #BFM #Medias #Journalisme #MarineTondelier #Ecologie #RN #Bardella #Attal #DirectAN #Legislatives

item.title: JuneSim63
item.description: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court has found that United Utilities can be held to account for the damage caused by sewage discharges.The ruling has set a watershed precedent which now breaks the shield around polluting water companies – leaving them open to a potential deluge of legal action.Well done, the Good Law Project and the Environmental Law Foundation.#Water #Privatisation #UnitedUtilities #Law #Sewage #Pollution https://goodlawproject.org/supreme-court-opens-the-floodgates-for-sewage-dumping-challenges/

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Post your hottest result that ended up in the supplement.

item.title: Dalipas :unverified:🏳️‍🌈🇬🇹
item.description: Marine Tondelier : On va arrêter 5mn la plaisanterie.

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description:
@sls Figure 6—figure supplement 1: identified neurons in #Drosophila can present stochastic, spontaneous variations in their arbors that most often don't impact synaptic connectivity but sometimes they do, and yet, the nervous system works just fine. Hints at circuit-level robustness.Figure 7—figure supplement 1: measuring the amount of presynaptic and postsynaptic sites in both the axon and in the dendrite delivers a rather unique signature of each neuron, by way of the Segregation Index, recognizable across the left and right hemispheres, and also across developmental time (not shown).Figure 10—figure supplement 1: when multiple people reconstruct the same neuron, if they are well trained, the result is almost identical. Only when poorly trained variations (errors, really) emerge.From: "Quantitative neuroanatomy for connectomics[ in Drosophila", Schneider-Mizell et al. 2016
https://elifesciences.org/articles/12059/figures#fig6s1#neuroscience #connectomics

item.title: d a t green
item.description: The US Supreme Court’s weak and partisan judgment on presidential immunityThe majority of the court did not engage with the rule of lawNew by me, at Prospect https://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/ideas/law/67136/the-us-supreme-courts-weak-and-partisan-judgment-on-presidential-immunity

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Denisovans lived for over 100,000 years on the Tibetan plateau, hunting snow leopards and golden eagles and other animals. Here's my story on these remarkable people [Gift link] https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/science/denisovans-ice-age-hunting-tibet.html?unlocked_article_code=1.4U0.bhkb.sDDNm9NmFCPB&smid=url-share
